analysis.Summary: Vue 3 single-file component that renders the application footer. It applies a light or dark theme based on the current route meta, loads category data from the store, and provides localized text strings via vue-i18n.
analysis.Purpose: To provide a site-wide footer UI with dynamic theming and internationalized copy, including copyright info, brand name, tagline, and (commented-out) additional links.

Components.name: Footer
responsibilities: Apply dynamic CSS classes based on `route.meta.footer_theme`

Functions.name: defineProps
Functions.purpose: Define and type-check the `theme` prop with default 'light'.

Functions.name: onMounted
Functions.purpose: Lifecycle hook; invokes `categories.actions.read()` to fetch category data when the component mounts.

Functions.name: useI18n
Functions.purpose: Initialize the translation function `t` with the locally defined `text` messages object.

analysis.Usage: Imported into a layout or parent component (e.g. App.vue or default layout). Usage example in template: `<Footer :theme="'dark'" />`. The component reads `route.meta.footer_theme` for runtime theming.
Notes: Much of the richer footer content is currently commented out (social links, categories list, pages).
Relies on `categories.state.all` to populate localized category names into the i18n messages.
There is a reference in the template to `getMarketplaceLink` which is not defined in this file; likely provided via global mixin or parent scope.
The `<style>` block is empty, expecting global or external SCSS styles to apply.
